longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and/or passport replacing documents must be valid
  on arrival. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Holders of normal or temporary
passports issued to nationals of United Arab Emirates can
obtain a visa on arrival. Fee: USD 105.-. 
- Holders of an "Entry Permit" issued by the Sudanese Ministry
  of interior can obtain a visa on arrival, for a max. stay of
  60 days. Extension possible.
Additional Information:
- Visas issued by South Sudan cannot be used to enter Sudan. 
- Extension of stay possible. Fee: SDG 5,000.-.
Warning:
- Admission refused to holders of passports or travel
  documents containing a visa or entry stamp issued by Israel
vaccination:
Passengers arriving within 6 days after leaving or transiting
countries with risk of yellow fever transmission For details, click here
and not holding a yellow fever vaccination certificate are
subject to vaccination and quarantine upon arrival.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
Recommended:
- Vaccination against yellow fever for all travellers aged 9
  months or older travelling to areas south of the Sahara
  desert.
  Malaria prophylaxis. prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due
  to P. falciparum, exists throughout the year in the whole
  country. Risk is low and seasonal in the north. It is higher
  in the central and southern parts of the country. Malaria
  risk on the Red Sea coast is very limited. Recommended
  prevention: C.
